page.title: 17HOP GROWING IN CAPEL.
page.content: THE ATTRACTIVE CONICAL OASTS WITH NEAT WHITE COWLS AND VANES PUNCTUATING THE SKYLINE DEMONSTRATE THE IMPORTANCE OF HOP GROWING TO LOCAL FARMERS.{HOPS {HAVE FLOURISHED IN THIS HEAVY FERTILE {LOAM FOR CENTURIES}AND BEEN LABOUR INTENSIVE. "STRINGING THE GARDENS" WAS ONCE DONE ON STILTS! FEWER WORKERS ARE NOW REQUIRED DUE TO MECHANIZATION BUT {MANY LOCAL WOMEN STILL DO "TWIDDLING", TRAINING THE HOPS TO CLIMB. PICKING BEGINS IN SEPTEMBER AND THE FAMILIAR "HOPPY" AROMA WAFTS INTO SCHOOL FROM TATLINGBURY AS GOLDEN HOPS GENTLY DRY IN THE WARM DARK OASTS.{UNTIL 25 YEARS {AGO HUNDREDS OF LONDONERS LODGED IN {HOPPERS HUTS ON FARMS PICKING BY HAND {INTO BINS.}"THEHOPPERS PARSON", FATHER RICHARD WILSON, WORKED IN OUR PARISH TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS.{NOW NOISY {BRIMMIMG TRAILERS BRING HOP BINES FROM {THE GARDENS TO BE STRIPPED BY MACHINE.
